page.title: 05BROMLEY AMBULANCE STATION
page.content: The ambulance station on Bromley Common is built on the site of an old pond - that's why it floods sometimes. It was built about twelve years ago and is a very modern building. Eighty three people work there. It takes about five minutes to get to Bromley Hospital by ambulance. They are contacted directly from a switchboard at Waterloo. The station officer said that you should always make sure that your ambulance is fully equipped. There are ambulances for people who can walk, people in wheelchairs and those for emergencies. We were shown the equipment carried by an emergency ambulance such as a stretcher that opens like a pair of scissors, inflatable splints, oxygen equipment and maternity packs. The most common reason for being called out is when someone collapses.
